column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Tuvan alphabet, written in the Cyrillic script.

name
  1. Kyzyl (the capital city of the Tuva Republic, Russia)

character
  1. The thirty-second letter of the Tuvan alphabet

verb
  1. (intransitive, + ablative) to be sick, suffer of
  2. (intransitive) to hurt, ache, sting

verb
  1. modal converb of ак- (ak-, “to flow”, affirmative stem)

adj
  1. easy

intj
  1. A greeting, more formal than экии; hello, greetings

noun
  1. peace, tranquility

verb
  1. (intransitive) to become
  2. (auxiliary) to must, have to do

noun
  1. bee; wasp
  2. north slope (yin side) of a mountain

noun
  1. house (fixed residence, as opposed to a yurt)
  2. building

particle
  1. Hyphenated after a word, forming its comitative or instrumental case.

conj
  1. and

verb
  1. (transitive) to know, understand
  2. (auxiliary, + -п) to be able to, can

verb
  1. to be, become
  2. (auxiliary, + -п) indicates permission or feasibility of an action

verb
  1. to give
  2. (auxiliary) Used to form the perfective of a verb, following its imperfective converbal in variant -е (-e), -э (-e), -и (-i), -ү (-ü), -а (-a), -ы (-ı), -у (-u), or -й (-y)
  3. (auxiliary) Used to indicate an action having its external concern or purpose, following associative converbal in -п (-p) or its epenthetic variants

particle
  1. (in the form …-даа, …-даа) both … and … (affirmatively); neither … nor … (negatively)
  2. (after a conditional verb) even if

noun
  1. short for үгер-даа (üger-daa, “appointed chief of a banner”)

noun
  1. number (sequence of digits)
  2. Forms ordinals out of cardinal numbers.

verb
  1. (transitive) to say, tell
  2. (transitive) to touch

postp
  1. until, up to (of time)

noun
  1. sky

verb
  1. (intransitive) to descend, go down
  2. (intransitive) to fall, drop

pron
  1. (demonstrative) that (far from the speaker and listener)

pron
  1. (demonstrative) those (far from the speaker and listener)

verb
  1. (transitive) to hope for, expect
  2. (transitive, + dative) to believe in, trust

verb
  1. (transitive) to leave, put down, place
  2. (auxiliary, + -п) indicates completeness of an action

conj

verb
  1. (transitive) to add
  2. (transitive, mathematics) to add, sum

verb
  1. (intransitive) to remain, be left
  2. (auxiliary) to end up doing

noun
  1. hull, skin, shell

verb
  1. to cut, carve,
  2. to reap
  3. to cross (e.g. the street)

verb
  1. to enter, go in
  2. (auxiliary, + -п) to start (doing something)

noun
  1. a kozhuun, a banner (administrative division, originally Mongolian military subdivision)

verb
  1. (intransitive, transitive, + allative case) to be afraid, fear

noun
  1. (⁓ чон, ⁓ улус) the Chinese (people)
  2. (⁓ кижи) Chinese (person)

verb
  1. (transitive) to see
  2. (auxiliary, + -п) Used to soften a request; please

pron
  1. I (first-person singular subject pronoun)

particle
  1. Forms the first-person singular predicative when used in conjunction with nouns, adjectives, and certain verb tenses, including the present-future and indefinite past.

adj
  1. (demonstrative) like this, this kind of

adv
  1. (demonstrative) thus, in this way

verb
  1. (transitive) to play (a game, a sport, an instrument, etc.)

verb
  1. modal converb of ойна- (oyna-, “to play”, affirmative stem)

verb
  1. (transitive) to throw, toss
  2. (transitive) to load a bullet

pron
  1. he, she, it (third-person singular subject pronoun)
  2. (demonstrative) that, this

verb
  1. to sit
  2. (auxiliary, + -п) Used to form the habitual aspect for certain verbs, namely when the subject is sat down or otherwise stationary.
  3. (auxiliary, олур + -п) Used to form the progressive tense for certain verbs, namely when the subject is sat down or otherwise stationary.

adj
  1. proper

conj
  1. (conditional) as soon as

adv
  1. (spatial) there, in that place
  2. (temporal) then, at that time

noun
  1. a president (of a state or an organisation)

verb
  1. to sell
  2. to deal, to trade
  3. (chess) to exchange

noun
  1. (transitive) to remember, recall

noun
  1. (transitive) to introduce, to cause to meet

noun
  1. a Telengit, an Altaian, or a Teleut (person)

verb
  1. (transitive) to hold, grasp
  2. (transitive) to build, construct

verb
  1. to stand, get up
  2. (auxiliary, + -п) Used to form the habitual aspect for most verbs, including when the subject's physical position is unimportant or unknown.
  3. (auxiliary, тур + -п) Used to form the progressive tense for most verbs, including when the subject's physical position is unimportant or unknown.

verb
  1. (transitive) to end, put to an end

verb
  1. modal converb of уду- (udu-, “to sleep”, affirmative stem)

verb
  1. (transitive) to deliver, give
  2. (transitive) to make take responsibility

verb
  1. (transitive) to accept, receive
  2. (transitive) to acknowledge, recognise
  3. (transitive) to take responsibility

verb
  1. (intransitive) to sing in khoomei, throat sing

noun
  1. harmony, tuning
  2. (figuratively) interest, intention
  3. (+ verb) Indicates inclination or desire to do something, especially when in negation.

verb
  1. (auxiliary, + -п) cannot
  2. (auxiliary, in the negative) Indicates possibility or probability; perhaps, possibly, might, maybe

noun
  1. journey, trip
  2. A word put after adjectives in order to form certain nouns; manner, way

verb
  1. to go, walk
  2. (auxiliary, + -п) Used to form the habitual aspect for certain verbs, namely when the subject is moving.
  3. (auxiliary, чор + -п) Used to form the progressive tense for certain verbs, namely when the subject is moving.

verb
  1. to lie down
  2. (auxiliary, + -п) Used to form the habitual aspect for certain verbs, namely when the subject is lying down or otherwise stationary.
  3. (auxiliary, чыдыр + -п) Used to form the progressive tense for certain verbs, namely when the subject is lying down or otherwise stationary.

adj
  1. (demonstrative) such, that kind of

adv
  1. (demonstrative) thus, in that way

verb
  1. (causative) to make … sing
  2. (causative) to play (a recording)
